entry.title: Welcome to the new SnugglesStuff!
entry.content:
This is SnugglesStuff 1.5, a new version of SnugglesStuff, built to be amazing!

What’s new?

  • The engine (now using Hexo)
  • The host (now using Github Pages, future apps by SnugglesStuff will be built using Heroku and Node.js)
  • The layout (now using the Landscape theme)

Ok, that doesn’t make any sense. What can I expect?

  • Speed!
  • A new look!

When will there be new posts?

MUCH, much more often. I will do posts at most daily, at usally weekly, and at least monthly.

Closing

This is the future of SnugglesStuff, and I hope you’re exicited![1]

[1]. And yes, you can still expect perfect grammar.

entry.title: Flappy Bird For The 3DS (+ Site News)
entry.content:
First of all, sorry for not posting in a while. This was because I had nothing to post about and I lost some of my interest in SnugglesStuff. To make up, I’ll give you one of the best articles I can!

What it is:

Someone made the game Flappy Bird on the 3DS/DSi. For some people “Flappy Bird” is an “odd shade of blue”; according to the creator, they didn’t set it up properly.

What is Flappy Bird?

Flappy Bird is an (extremely annoying) game. To play you tap the screen to jump through pipes. If you touch a pipe you lose. You get one point for every pipe you pass through.

The controls:

The controls are pretty good. You either tap the screen or press A to jump.

How it works:

It uses an app called “Petit Computer” by SmileBoom to run. Petit Computer allows you to run and write programs in the language “SmileBasic”.

How to get it?

  1. Go here (http://img2.wikia.nocookie.net/__cb20140212022026/petitcomputer/images/thumb/b/b3/Flappy_Bird_QR.png/512px-Flappy_Bird_QR.png) on your computer.
  2. Open Petit Computer on your 3DS/DSi.
  3. Tap “File Management”.
  4. Tap “Read QR Code”.
  5. Line the red box up with the boxes until you have scanned every one.
  6. Tap “Back” if it is on-screen.
  7. Tap “View gallery”.
  8. Tap “FLAPBIRD”.

How to run it:

  1. Tap “Back” if it is on-screen.
  2. Tap “View gallery”.
  3. Tap “FLAPBIRD”.

entry.title: Aero Glass in Windows 8.1
entry.content:
Aero Glass in Windows 8.1. It’s right here. And there is finally an installer. It’s a small detail but I miss it. A lot. (If you are wondering what Aero Glass is, it is some transparency on window borders.)

OK. So here is before:

 

And here is how to do it:

NOTE: You need 7-zip or winRAR for this tutorial.

  1. Right click on your Start button.
  2. Click System.
  3. Look under the category labeled System.
  4. Look at System type.
  5. If it says “64-bit Operating System” then remember 64-bit otherwise remember 32-bit.
  6. Close the window.
  7. Go Here.
  8. Look under Aero Glass for Win8.1 RTM Pre-release.
  9. Click 32-bit Windows or 64-bit Windows depending on what you remember.
  10. Wait five seconds.
  11. Open the file.
  12. Extract it to “C:\AeroGlass”.
  13. Open “C:\AeroGlass”.
  14. Run “install.bat” as administrator.
  15. Reboot.
  16. Wait.
  17. Click “Yes”.
  18. See your Aero Glass in Windows 8.1!
    After you do this:

So… There you go. Aero Glass in Windows 8.

UPDATE: Sometimes it does not work but this is rare.
entry.summary: Aero Glass in Windows 8.1. It’s right here. And there is finally an installer. It’s a small detail but I miss it. A lot. (If you are wondering what Aero Glass is, it is some transparency on window borders.)
